item.title: Building Emacs from source
item.description: Steps needed to install emacs locally, mantaining pre-existing installation intact. In the end you will two different versions of emacs running in your system. Install dependencies: sudo apt-get install autoconf automake libtool texinfo build-essential xorg-dev libgtk-3-dev libjpeg-dev libncurses5-dev libdbus-1-dev libgif-dev libtiff-dev libm17n-dev libpng-dev librsvg2-dev libotf-dev libgnutls28-dev libxml2-dev libxpm-dev Download emacs from a nearby mirror Extract downloaded file. In this case it is emacs-26.3.tar.xz, and go to the extracted folder: cd ~/Downloads tar -xf emacs-26.
